document.masterDocTitle: New species of Triplonychus Candèze and Globothorax Fleutiaux from Brazil (Coleoptera, Elateridae, Cardiophorinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Triplonychus Candèze and Globothorax Fleutiaux from Brazil (Coleoptera, Elateridae, Cardiophorinae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. From Latin, crus = leg; spinosus = spiny, alluding to the spinose legs of this species.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Triplonychus cruspinosus
sp. nov .
1, antenna; 2, mandible (dorsal); 3–5, prothorax (dorsal, lateral, ventral); 6, abdomen; 7, 8, pterothorax (ventral, lateroventral).

FIGURES 9–14.
Triplonychus cruspinosus
sp. nov .
9, tergite 8; 10, sternite 8; 11, sternite 9; 12, tergites 9 and 10; 13, 14, aedeagus (ventral, dorsal). Abbreviation: vs, ventral sclerite of penis.

subSubSection.paragraph: Aedeagus ( Figs. 13, 14 ). Parameres with apex acute directed lateroventrad, without setae, articulated to penis by a transparent membrane. Penis with a ventral sclerite oval about 3.4 times longer than wide, basal struts 0.4 times as long as its total length, median region between basal struts with a triangular process; lateral margins tapering to rounded apex.

Type material.
Holotype . [ Brasil , Reserva Ducke, 26 Km NE Manaus, Barbosa, M.G.V.], [Plot A, malaise 1 , DEZ/ 1995 ], [ 62 ], [0031799], male ( INPA ).

Remarks. Hundreds of male specimens were collected with malaise trap from November to May, with peak population in February at the height of the rainy season. No females have been collected.
